intro: Commelina vanderystii, commonly known as Vanderyst's spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many species of dayflowers and spiderworts. The plant features striking blue-violet flowers with three petals and three sepals, often accompanied by a distinctive white or yellow spatulate bract. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical study.
